data.title: If debug session is active all non-debug hovers are disabled
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 (Insiders)

Steps to Reproduce:

- use a deprecated attribute in a launch.json, e.g. `externalConsole`
- hover over the value: you will see a hover explaining the deprecation
- start debug session
- hover over the deprecated attribute value: no hover shows up

We should try to only disable regular hovers in files that are actually 'in scope' of the debug session.

data.title: Preserve language picked for untitled text documents
data.body:
* create a new document
* select language to JavaScript
* type code
* exit and restart VS Code
* üêõ the untitled file shows as Plaintext

data.title: Display the edit icon in settings with a small delay
data.body:
Currently if you move the mouse fastly around the settings the icon apperas everywhere franticly. I would show it with a slight delay to make the experience smoother.
The gif does not illustrate well the franticness but you see what I am trying to point out :)

![settingsfrantic](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/20964331/62b72ce4-bc71-11e6-9ff9-714d337a5fcd.gif)

data.title: inconsistent highlighting after method
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-file-peek|abierbaum|1.0.1|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.1|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.1.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.7.1|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.6|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.8|
|contextualduplicate|lafe|0.2.0|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.2.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.3.2|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.20.4|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create typescript file
```ts
interface A {
    prop1: string
    prop2: string
    method1(): void
    prop3: string
    prop4: string
}
```
2. Properties after a method are not highlighted

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1114090/20963982/bd265ccc-bc80-11e6-8568-ec1377c835b4.png)

data.title: Settings: edit action seems to be in my way often
data.body:
I do like that we have an action but I find that it is in my way often when editing the right hand side. In other words it is hard to click at the end of a line:

![screen shot 2016-12-07 at 11 19 43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20963786/2a16d666-bc6f-11e6-91d9-a40609013fa4.png)

I am not sure if this is planned but wasn't the idea once to show the action to the left?

data.title: Activity bar: show position viewlet will move to while drag and drop
data.body: Instead of replacing the dragged viewlet with the one to drop on, it would be nice to animate this (similar to how editors are animated when moved) so that you see exactly where a viewlet will move to.

data.title: Unexpected suggestion selected
data.body:
I would expect `proxy` to be the selected suggestion in this case, given the completion item type. I know this might contradict with the shortest suggestion rule, but it was really unexpected for me when I ended up in a complicated snippet when I wanted to do a "trivial" property assignment in a ctor.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/20962289/06001680-bc69-11e6-8713-5c3ec871f4c2.png)

settings:
```
{
	"editor.fontFamily": "Hack",
	"editor.fontSize": 16,
	"editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary",
	"editor.renderIndentGuides": true,
	"files.autoSave": "afterDelay",
	"editor.renderLineHighlight": "gutter",
	"telemetry.enableTelemetry": false,
	"telemetry.enableCrashReporter": false,
	"editor.wordSeparators": "`~!@#%^&*()-=+[{]}\\|;'\",.<>/?"
}
```

data.title: How to configure VS Code on Windows to run a task in WSL?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1607

I want to run a task in WSL to run 'make', so I defined the task as:

    {
        "version": "0.1.0",
        "command": "c:/Windows/sysnative/bash.exe",
        "isShellCommand": true,
        "args": ["-c 'cd /mnt/c/myproj/trunk/software/Source/; make'"],
        "showOutput": "always"
    }

when I run it I see:

    error 0x80070057

interspersed with '?' characters in the output window.  

What is wrong with my task definition?

data.title: Error message "Linter pylint is not installed" persists after "Disable this linter" is clicked
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a .py file.
2. Open another .py file, add something and save.
3. Error "Linter pylint is not installed" appears.
4. Click on "Disable this Linter"
5. Edit the file again and save.
6. Error "Linter pylint is not installed" appears AGAIN.

Note.
Close and restart VS Code does not solve the issue.
I don't want pylint (it is too noisy).

Thanks,
Alessandro

data.title: Application top menu does not unhide in Zen Mode when mouse is at top
data.body: - VSCode Version: Insiders - OS Version: Linux (Ubuntu) test item #15647 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Enter Zen Mode on Ubuntu 2. Note that you cannot get your OS top app bar back (e.g. File, View, Help...) when hovering at the top of the screen like you can on Mac (or on Linux when not in Zen Mode). Should be able to see this when mouse is at top, so it's easy to discover how to get out of Zen Mode.

data.title: GIT commands are slow
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.7.2
- OS Version: windows 7 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:

All the git operations are slow. For example, it costs about 3 seconds to stage a file in a very small repository.  

I manual run the same git command:  `git add -A -- testfile.txt` in the terminal, it's very fast. 

I run the profile in the develop tools, but the total times are small, execpt `(idle)` and `(program)`. 

About the git:

I install the git from https://git-scm.com/, the version is git version 2.11.0.windows.1, 32bit.  and set the path in `settings.json` as following:

```
"git.path": "C:/Program Files (x86)/Git/cmd/git.exe"
```

here is the output of `where git` in the terminal:

```
where git
C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\cmd\git.exe
C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\bin\git.exe
```

So, I am using the same git.exe.

I also tried git 64 bit, but it's even slower then the 32bit version.

This happens to my two 64bit windows PC. But on an other 32bit windows PC, its's very fast.

data.title: Option to exclude items from Git branch checkout list #13506
data.body:
Here are my proposed changes to solve issue #13506.. This is an implementation of what @joaomoreno proposed in the ticket.. I've added a setting named `checkoutType` which controls what is listed inside the quick open panel for the git checkout command (`all` is as it is today, `local` is only local branches, `tags` is local branches and tagged commits, `remote` is local branches and remote branches... Happy to change names/descriptions of anything :) ).

I believe these are the minimal amount of changes to do this. Poking around, I could see a couple other ways you'd do it, either getting the config service into the `CheckoutCommand` (which seemed like a large refactor) or using the setting as a filter on the `GitService` for what's exposed as `model`/`head`/`refs` (which also seemed like a large refactor and could change other consumers).. If one of those are the desired approach, I think that my changes should be abandoned and someone else would have to take over that effort (as I'm not familiar enough with the larger application).

There's still some things I'm unsure of. For example, we could branch inside the `CheckoutCommand`'s `getResult` method instead of using empty arrays for `tags`/`remoteHeads` (I just thought it added an unnecessary level of complexity). Another example is maybe using a private `_checkoutType` on the `GitService` and set it as part of the `onDidUpdateConfiguration` handler (this would be more similar to `allowHugeRepositories`, but since there isn't an override I don't know that it's necessary (and very possible I'm misunderstanding some intents here).. It's also very possible there's other completely different things I overlooked/you guys would know more about.

I looked for tests related to either the `CheckoutCommand` or the git settings and had trouble finding anything that I could base things on. If you had any suggestions or places to look at for similar tests, I'd be happy to take a stab at automating something. I did run all local tests and linting and they passed and reported nothing (respectively).

I did test this locally with this repo to ensure that 1) The setting existed/had the description and options I expected 2) The drop down respected the settings I picked (and that it updated without restarting) 3) I could still switch branches

Thanks for the great product!

Edit: reread this this morning and noticed I had some bad English in some places.. Also signed the CLA (and got confirmation from it), but the bot hasn't updated this. Is there anything else I should do for that? I wasn't expecting one line for the address, so maybe I messed it up.

data.title: Moving Settings to New Tab Causes Default Settings to Go Empty
data.body:
1.8 insiders

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have two tabs open.
2. Open settings
3. Drag settings to other tab

See default settings area go blank

![dec-06-2016 17-34-20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20951377/3cc1bb0e-bbda-11e6-8cb2-f973a6f97f9a.gif)

data.title: Language mode picker should give precise language matches higher priority
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10, 1607ish

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Press Ctrl+K, M to open the Language Mode picker

2.¬†Type "C" to select the C language  (or "R" to¬†select the R language; or "D" to select the D language¬†[if you have code-d installed])

EXPECTED:
The C language is selected.

ACTUAL:
Some random¬†menu option is selected.  I can't find anything that I could type to get exactly the C language.  I tried "(c)" and "C (c)" and "C99" and "CC" and "C " and "^c".  I eventually had to resort to the arrow keys¬†to wade through the list.

PROPOSAL:
If I type something short like "c" or "go", and¬†there's a language that¬†exactly matches that name, always select the menu option for that specific language.  Only resort to fuzzy/substring matching if there's no language with exactly that name.

(btw, I'm new to VS code, so if¬†there's an obvious pre-existing solution to this,¬†please educate me!  Thanks)

data.title: Text for show/hide Status/Activity bar in View menu should say "toggle"
data.body:
Testing #15812

Most of the other visibility related options are "Toggle something".
Why is the Status Bar and Activity Bar of the form "Show/Hide something" ?
We should be consistent.

The corresponding commands for Status Bar and Activity Bar say "Toggle Side/Activity Bar Visibility"

data.title: How to get process id of a process started via RunInTerminalRequest via the debug protocol
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

I'm trying to implement a debug adapter for the julia language. At this stage I'm just trying to get the Ctrl+F5 functionality going. I'm using the ``RunInTerminalRequest`` to start the current julia script. How can I get the process ID for the instance of julia that I'm starting in that way? The ``RunInTerminalResponse`` has an optional field ``processId``, but the response I get for my ``RunInTerminal`` request never contains that information. I tried both the ``integrated`` and ``external`` option for ``kind``, but in neither case do I get a process id back.

data.title: Ubuntu - launch configs don't show up in viewlet picker at first
data.body:
- Have all windows of vscode closed
- Open vscode, open a project with a launch.json which has never been opened before (or never debugged before?)
- Open the debug viewlet
- See that the configs don't show up

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/20949810/6df21106-bbd0-11e6-8f28-4e196803dccf.png)

If I click the dropdown, I can see all the options. If I pick one, it shows up in the picker. Once it shows up, it will always show up on relaunching vscode.

data.title: View Scale: Missing check mark
data.body:
Testing: #16326 

- VSCode Version: 1.8-insiders
- OS Version: Win

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open dependancies view in debug mode.  
2. Activate via `view` menu
3. It's now in the activity bar.  But there is no check-mark right click `context` menu.  There probably shoudl be...

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/20949673/899aa5a4-bbcf-11e6-8fd5-ee36f031cc8c.png)

4. Additionally is it possible to add that tot he view meny like we do for AutoSave
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/20949709/b7addce0-bbcf-11e6-9bb3-e0814eaa59d3.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/20949714/c1257418-bbcf-11e6-81fc-52b557d7e04d.png)


Sean

data.title: View Scale: Command Palete Entry for View Addition

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
testing: #16326 

- VSCode Version: 1.8-insiders
- OS Version: windows

Steps to Reproduce:

Should we have a command pallet entry that mimics what right clicking in the activity bar does or the `view->Additional Viewlets` menu without it you are forced to use the mouse.

Somehting in here:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/20949621/260e3d52-bbcf-11e6-9a67-4b48455c12eb.png)

data.title: View: Additional Viewlets should be scoped to the windows workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing: #16326 

- VSCode Version: 1.8-insiders
- OS Version: Win

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Code and see no item in the view menu:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/20949404/edba9532-bbcd-11e6-985b-464248f807ad.png)

2. Load up the dependancies extension and `F5`
3. See the `view->Additional Viewlets` item in _both_ the extension host instance and standard...
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/20949426/168ab834-bbce-11e6-87ee-29a55c534f2c.png)

4. Close the extension host and it's still there in the root host.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/20949449/3357a7ce-bbce-11e6-8e87-08e5de7cf389.png)

5. If you click on it you get the following error:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/20949459/432da018-bbce-11e6-8950-ee1280655a2f.png)

Seams like ideally it would not appear in any other instance other than the extension host unless loaded.

Sean

data.title: Visual glitch when showing native dialog on Ubuntu
data.body:
Testing Electron update - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15811

This is probably because I'm running it in a VM, but I don't remember seeing it before, so @Tyriar can you repro this?

In the file explorer, right click anything and click 'delete'. The confirm dialog shows up, and there are various glitches. Different every time. Usually there will be some blinking and the Code window will disappear and I see a distorted view of whatever's behind it.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/20949289/6b5b18c8-bbcd-11e6-9b1b-52c3f5b6d079.png)

data.title: Trailing comma in settings stops editing of settings via the copy action icon
data.body:
Testing #16530 

 Add a trialing comma to the last setting in user settings `"editor.fontSize": 14,`. Now try to change setting using the icon. You get error message 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/20948991/dd87946e-bbcb-11e6-9e85-88d9743181e0.png)

data.title: Fix #16432 - rejected promise not handled
data.body:
Fixes #16432

This error was Introducing during null check refeactoring. Before the promise was set to null inside the promise. I added a rejection because the empty  promise value should never actually be used, but it seems the rejection introduced a regression.

Fix is to use `p` inside of the promise instead.

data.title: Clearer message in the Default settings
data.body:
Testing #16530 

The message at the top can be made clearer

 "Overwrite these settings by placing them into your settings file **to the right**"

data.title: Navigating up the collapsed groups skips alternate groups
data.body:
Testing #16530 

Click on any of the group heading. Use SPACE to collapse and down arrow key to go to the next group. Repeat (Collapse and move to next) until you reach the end. Now use up arrow key to move up. Notice that alternate groups get skipped while going up.

data.title: Searchbox has focus while navigating filtered list
data.body:
Testing #16530


While using `Enter` to navigate the filtered settings, the cursor focus is still in search box which is confusing.

data.title: Option to trigger copy setting action via keyboard

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #16530

- While using `Enter` to navigate the filtered settings, there is no way to trigger the "copy" action using just keyboard. Can we use arrow keys to navigate instead and use Enter to trigger the "copy" action?
